page.title: 03RESERVOIRS IN CHINGFORD
page.content: There used to be several farms in Chingford but the land has been built on now.One farmhouse has been developed as a pub -{the Larkswood}. Sheep,however are still to be found in Chingford.They together with some horses,graze around the reservoir.The reservoir in our area is called the {William Girling reservoir}.Areservoir is a large pool of water.The water we use in our homes comes from the reservoir,which is owned by Thames Water Authority.The reservoir is very deep because it has to give water to the whole of Chingford.There is a fence around it so people don't fall in!There are walls to prevent waves forming.The reservoir is about a 1/4 of a mile square.There is a boating club near where club members sail. Wind-surfing,water-skiing and board- sailing also take place.
